line.del: During the scene morning slowly breaks.

zone.line: Homer & Hesiod say the same things?--Ion
Many, as it seems to me. Soc. [?If] [Should]
whether
[?should]
you illustrate these topics better
as treated by Homer or Hesiod?-- Ion.--
In the same manner doubtless inasmuch
as they say the same words with respect
to the same things. Soc. But with
regard to those things in which they
differ; divination for instance? Ion
I feel that
Certainly I could explain them.-- Soc.
^ you do imagine, that
But whether or not you or a diviner
would
make the best exposition respecting
those poets
all that they say of divination, whether
both as they agree & as they differ.--
Ion A diviner certainly. Soc. If you
were a diviner do
these are mine empire.
